definition[0]: if you divide something fifty-fifty, you divide it equally between two people, companies etc
example[0]: Weâ€™ll share it on a fifty-fifty basis.
example[1]: The companies split the profits fifty-fifty.
example[2]: We went fifty-fifty on a new TV set.
definition[1]: if there is a fifty-fifty chance of something happening, it is as equally likely to happen as not to happen
definition[2]: divided or shared equally between two people, companies etc
example[4]: It was suggested that they continue the development on a fifty-fifty cost-sharing basis.
definition[3]: having an equal chance of happening in one of two ways
example[5]: You have a fifty-fifty chance of winning.
